body:
Bravo
On Jan 25, 2013 11:32 PM, "Tim Chevalier" notifications@github.com wrote:

> r? @pcwalton https://github.com/pcwalton - Disallow structural records
> by default, allow them at the crate level where necessary, remove uses of
> 
> ## them from various code.
> 
> You can merge this Pull Request by running
> 
>   git pull https://github.com/catamorphism/rust forbid-structural-records
> 
> Or view, comment on, or merge it at:
> 
>   https://github.com/mozilla/rust/pull/4645
> Commit Summary
> - std: Fix broken Windows function
> - syntax/rustc: Less copy
> - comments: Convert XXXes to FIXMEs
> - clean up LinearMap implementation
> - rustc: Less copy
> - core: Mop up Windows breakage
> - testsuite: Eliminate uses of structural records from most run-pass
>   tests
> - cargo: remove structural records
> - fuzzer: Remove structural records
> - compiletest: Allow legacy records
> - rustc: In lint, forbid structural records unless legacy_records is on
> - rustc: Add legacy_records field to the type context
> - Add #[legacy_records] crate attribute
> - core: Allow legacy records in in a few modules
> - testsuite: Add #[allow(structural_records)] to pipes tests
>
